title: What should I include in my letter to the seller (heirs of a deceased owner of the property)? We are about to put an offer on a 1790 built landmark house. My agent told me to write a letter to the seller. Should I include a condolence note? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes..be Authentically Human…coinnect. Show them you are a Good, Regular Guy. Explain the use you and be transparent…sometimes a Good Vision that may work may compel them also to grant you a Balance of Sale-Mortgage either first or second....they then finance part or all of the sale and you pay interest to them, say 3.5%. Mention the good things and mention the bad things about the property. Tell them that their property is worth more..however you cannot afford more than what is in your offer given the works required and given the amount of cash you have and your limited borrowing capacity. Good luck.

Perhaps make mention of it in the beginning. Dear xxxx, Please accept my sincere condolences on the loss of your loved one. My heart goes out to you during this difficult time. I want to assure you that ….. then tell them about your family and how much you love the house especially certain parts of it. Definitely run this by your agent as they are more connected with the situation.
